text: Percival Noel James Patterson, ON, PC, QC (born 10 April 1935), is a Jamaican politician. He served as the sixth Prime Minister of Jamaica from 1992 to 2006."Profile on PJ Patterson" , Jamaica Observer, 12 October 2002. He was the leader of the People's National Party from 1992 to 2006 and as the Member of Parliament (MP) from 1970 to 1980 when he lost to the Jamaica Labour Party Euphemia Williams, and again from 1989 to 1993. He served as the MP for Westmoreland Eastern from 1993 to 2006. He retired in March 2006."Shirley Field-Ridley, 45, Held Posts in the Guyana Cabinet" (obituary), New York Times, 28 June 1982. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:Prime ministers of Jamaica
title: P. J. Patterson
